identificationModule.briefTitle: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for Psychosis: Aim 2
identificationModule.officialTitle: Feasibility, Acceptability, and Preliminary Effectiveness of a Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention-focused Intervention Tailored to Adults Diagnosed With Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorders: Aim 2 RCT

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Investigators will evaluate the feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of modified Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (CBSPp) in comparison to services-as-usual (SAU) in a randomized controlled trial. Investigators will recruit adult clients receiving services at a community mental health (CMH) setting who have a schizophrenia spectrum disorder and recent suicidal thoughts or behaviors within 3 months of screening (n=60). Client participants will be screened, enrolled and randomized to the CBSPp or SAU group. A 4-wave design will include quantitative assessments at baseline (T1), 1-month after baseline (T2), 3-months after baseline (T3), and 5-months after baseline (T4) with in-depth qualitative interviews at T3 for a random sample of adults in the CBSPp group (n=10). Providers (n=12) will be trained to deliver CBSPp and be assessed from T1-T3 to evaluate the implementation process, including in-depth qualitative interviews at T3.

armGroups.label: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (treatment group)
armGroups.description: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (CBSPp) is a behavioral treatment and will be delivered in 10 weekly individual therapy sessions in addition to standard/current services.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (CBSPp)

armGroups.label: Services as Usual (SAU; comparison group)
armGroups.description: Services as usual involve standard and current services that clients are eligible for receiving.

interventions.name: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (CBSPp)
interventions.description: Cognitive and behavioral approach to suicide prevention tailored for individuals with psychosis
armGroupLabels: Cognitive Behavioral Suicide Prevention for psychosis (treatment group)

interventions.name: Services as Usual (SAU)
interventions.description: Standard psychiatric and behavioral services provided at community mental health (e.g., case management, medication management)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Calgary Depression Rating Scale (CDRS) change from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure depression, higher scores indicate greater depression

primaryOutcomes.measure: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) change from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure psychosis symptoms, higher scores indicate greater psychosis

primaryOutcomes.measure: Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) change from baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure suicide thoughts and behavior, higher scores indicate greater suicide thoughts and behavior

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Beck Hopelessness Scale change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure hopelessness, higher scores indicate greater hopelessness

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Defeat Scale (D Scale) change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure defeat, higher scores indicate greater defeat

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The Entrapment Scale change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure entrapment, higher scores indicate greater entrapment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Suicide Stroop Task change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A cognitive Stroop tasks to assess information processing, information processing is evaluated in time

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Resilience Appraisals Scale (RAS) change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A scale to measure appraisals, higher scores indicate stronger resilience appraisals

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Suicide Concept Sort Task (SCS) change from baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: A cognitive card sorting task to assess schemas, cards are sorted as being closely related to not closely related to suicide as a concept

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder
* Suicide ideation and/or attempt within 3 months of screening
* Ability to speak and read in English
* 18 to 65 years of age

Exclusion Criteria:

* Requiring emergency care (e.g. imminent plan to harm self) as determined by trained research staff administering the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)
* Inappropriate for behavioral treatment according to own judgment in consultation with a treating clinician CMH
* Impaired capacity (cognitive capacity)

ancestors.term: Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders
